revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: [concluded in] the same [grapheion] in the sixteenth year of Hadrian the Lord on the second of Thoth, and which she returns to Onnophris for invalidation; and she shall not make any claim against Onnophris about what she has received, in accordance with the foregoing, in any manner � (2nd h.) I, Taarpharsis daughter of Eutychos, with my guardian Kronion my brother, agree that I have received from Onnophris the eighty drachmas and the interest and I shall make no claim in accord [with the justice]. And I Heron � have written for her as she does not know letters. (3rd h.) I, Onnophris son of Pakebkis, have the receipt. (4th h.) Holograph; [entered] at the grapheion in Tebtunis.

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., II.521; SB, XVIII, no. 13785; Plate: BASP v. 32 (1995), Pl. 6 Wall, E.W. New Texts in the Economy of Tebtunis, no. 4; on lines 5, 8, 9 and 18 see Keenan, J.G. BASP v. 32 (1995), p. 120
